monogr.title: An arrant thiefe, vvhom euery man may trust : in vvord and deed, exceeding true and iust. With a comparison betweene a thiefe and a booke. Written by Iohn Taylor
monogr.author: Taylor, John

div.l:
THis Water Rat,
The Annagram of Rat is Art. (or Art) I would commend,
But that I know not to begin or end:
He read his Verses to me, and which more is
Did moue my Muse to write Laudem Authoris,
If for his Land Discoueries I touch not his Trauailes to Scotland Germany, or Bohemia or the Paper Boate. she should praise him,
Whether would then his liquid knowledge raise him?
Reade his two Treatises of Theefe and Whore,
You le thinke it time for him to leaue his Oare.
Yet thus much of his worth I cannot smother,
Tis well for vs when Theeues peach one another.
This Preface is but poore, 'tis by a Boy done,
That is a Scholler of the Schoole of Croydon,
Who when he hath more yeares and learning got,
Hee'l praise him more or lesse, or not a jot.

closer.dateline: Giuen vpon Shroue Tuesday from our seate, in the second Forme of the famous free Schoole of Croydon.
